name: impudently
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is rude and does not show respect, especially towards someone who is older or in a more important position: The child impudently refused to obey, running in the opposite direction. "So what?" he said, grinning impudently at her.
More examplesFewer examplesHer impudently funny new version of the story follows the original plot closely.Now they impudently took no notice of his presence. He impudently dodged round the defence before touching down. The director was arrogant and often dealt impudently with his staff.She looked at him impudently over the corner of her newspaper.
